title: For Sale/Trade:  Heckler & Koch P2000SK V3 DA/SA 9x19mm
postcontent:
World-class firearm manufacturer Heckler and Koch made this sweet little piece for use by law enforcement, and the US Border patrol currently uses it. Has a barrel with polygonal rifling for greater muzzle energy and bullet velocity. This version has a Double Action/Single Action trigger with the smooooothest Double Action Trigger ever! You won't be losing your sight picture with this Double Action Trigger! The small magazine holds 10 rounds, and the larger one holds 13 rounds. Also has two backstraps - a small one, and a large one that are very easily interchangeable for larger and smaller hands. Great for CCW - about the same size as a Springfield XD Subcompact or a Glock 26.

This gun usually goes for $800 to $900 new with 1 10rd magazine and no holster. I have about 400 rounds through it with NO (count them - ZERO) failures to eject, feed, or fire. 

Comes with:
- 2 10 round magazines
- 2 13 round magazines
- 2 X-Grip magazine sleeves on the 13 round mags
- 2 interchangeable backstraps
- 2 pinky extensions
- Holster
- HK Hardcase
- Gun Lock

Pictures say it all. It's a great gun. I've put about 400 rounds through it. It shoots VERY well. Easy, tight groups. The grip is the most ergonomic grip that I have ever felt. It fits the hand very well. I've had zero problems with this gun. Very well cleaned and maintained.

title: For Sale:  280 rounds 7.62mm / .308 Win. plinking ammo!
location: near Ft. Benning, GA, Phenix City, Alabama
postcontent: 7.62mm / .308 Win. AMMO. I have 280 rounds that is stamped "RG 60 L2A2". The RG is allegedly for the British Royal Plant at "Radway Green", the 60 is allegedly for 1960, and L2A2 is for 147gr. FMJ 7.62mm NATO ammo. It was originally in a 300 round spam-can. I have since kept the ammo in ziploc bags in an ammo can. The cases are a reddish copper color the same as the bullet. I have recently been informed that this ammo is probably Chinese counterfeit. I don't like it, - so this goes to anyone looking for cheap plinking ammo. ~ $100.00 total for all!

title: For Sale/Trade:  1968 Honda CT90
postcontent:
I have a great condition 1968 Honda Trail 90 with ONLY 3,799 miles! This model has a 4 speed tranny plus hi/low option. I am 260+ lbs and this thing carries me with zero issues. In low, this bike is like a billygoat. I can stop on a 45 degree incline and it will start back up and start climbing with me on it! I have enjoyed it on the streets and have not had any problems keeping up with traffic.

This bike has a title, which is quite rare for these bikes! This is important if you plan on registering the bike for road use.

These are rare bikes, and fun to ride. I have never seen another.

Bike was running last season, however, I believe the carb may need to be cleaned. It turns over, but wont start currently. The issue could also be as simple as a low battery. I have a new battery for it, but dont have a 6volt charger to test it out. I just don't have the time this winter to tinker with it to get it going.

Good info: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honda_CT90

Shoot me cash or trade offers. I'd like to get this bike out of my garage by winter time.

postcontent:
The GLARE MOUT is a primary Non-Lethal laser dazzler, and is ideally suited for small-arms weapon integration, as well as mobile crew-served applications. A hand-held kit is also available for non-weapons-mounted deployment. When a suspect individual approaches a restricted or controlled area, the GLARE MOUT is able to hail and warn that person before shots have to be fired. Its shockingly bright beam sends an irrefutable, multi-lingual, cross-cultural message that you mean business. Reports confirm that the GLARE MOUT has saved numerous lives of both soldiers and non-combatants in Iraq and Afghanistan.

The GLARE MOUT has the best reliability rate of any laser system; only 1 per 6000 (0.00017%) has ever shown reduced performance... and that's after two years of in-theater abuse. It is the smallest and most versatile green laser dazzler in existence, and is already approved for use by all branches of the Armed Services. title: For Sale:  Baby Eagle 9mm
postcontent:
Up for sale is an early import Baby Eagle 9mm.  This is the IWI version imported by Magnum Research.  The early import is the Series 1 and does not have the rail on the frame.

This is as new, it has not been fired since sold at the dealer.  Comes with hard box and 2 magazines.  The tag is still on the trigger guard.  Always kept in a temperature controlled environment.

Sorry, no trades as I'm trying to fund a NFA purchase.

Face-to-face transaction, CCW permit holders preferred and your valid Missouri ID is required.  Buyer must be willing to sign a private bill of sale with a CCW.  Military members with a valid Missouri CCW will need to present their military ID as well as that Mo CCW card; a private bill of sale is mandatory for military members to protect you from your COC.  If you do not have a valid CCW then the transfer must go through a local FFL holder at the buyer's expense.

title: For Sale:  Norinco SKS-M takes AK mags
postcontent:
Norinco SKS M dated 1993, it's a sporter, factory built to take AK mags not a modified regular SKS. Monte Carlo Stock and 16" barrel. I have never fired it and did not receive a magazine when I purchased it. According to the guy I purchased it from was fired back in the mid 90s when he got it and has been in a closet ever since. He lost all of the accessories and the magazine. I have not disassembled the weapon but everything seems to function and move smoothly. The only defect I've discovered is a small scratch on the stock visible in pics.

I'll trade for a CZ75, or maybe other DA/SA 9mm metal frame, 45 ACP, or wheelguns. I might trade to 308 or 223 bolt actions as well. If the trades aren't dead even I might give a little or take a little boot if need be.

The rifle is a little heavy for me but well balanced and seems like it would handle well.

Glock 24C .40 caliber Long Slide.  These are very rare.  Glock only builds them every 4 or 5 years.  This one was built in 2009, purchased new in 2010.  

There's less than 300 rounds through this gun.  Comes with everything in the picture: Glock 24C, two 15 rd magazines, box, cleaning rod, mag loader, etc.

I'm a Glock Certified Armorer.  This pistol is in nearly new condition.  It runs flawlessly.

title: For Sale:  Remington 700 VLS in .223 Rem ***SUB-MOA SHOOTER***
postcontent:
I have a Remington 700 VLS chambered in Rem .223 for sale. I have had it for a number of years and have only fired it from the bench. It is in like-new condition with some minor work done. It has been consistently cleaned after every session at the range, and I also have every shot accounted for in a reloading journal. It has 473 total shots fired through it. The action and barrel have had no gunsmithing work done, but the barrel has been free floated. It currently has a Tasco 8-32x50 scope in Burris PosAllign rings mounted, and also has a Timney trigger installed. This rifle will shoot MOA or better with just about anything, with the best groups being handloads of 40 gr Nosler Ballistic Tips and Benchmark powder at around 3500 fps. I will include with the sale the reloading journal and any fireformed Winchester brass that I have. 

Price is $600 and is negotiable. 

E-mail me and I will reply with answers to questions.

The picture of the rifle is a little darker than it actually is.  The color is consisted from front to back.  I can send updated pics if necessary.

title: For Sale:  Savage 101 single shot .22
postcontent: The Savage 101 was an interesting gun made from 1960-1968. It is made to resemble a single-action revolver but is actually a single-shot; the barrel and cylinder swing out to load the shell and there is no cylinder rotation on firing (there's only one chamber). Not a terribly popular collectable, but does have a place in a comprehensive Savage collection OR makes a good addition to any collection of oddball handguns.

title: For Sale/Trade:  WW2 Arisaka Type 99 Last Ditch Rifle Matching Numbers & Chrysanthemum NEW PRICE
postcontent:
WW2 Japanese Arisaka 
Type 99  Last Ditch Rifle
Tokyo Juki Kogyo, Series 27
Matching Serial Numbers

A chrysanthemum with 16 petals (the symbol of the Japanese Emperor) is stamped on the receiver, it has not been ground off as was done with a number of these

Tokyo Juki Kogyo, Series 27, Serial # 41004 (one of the last ones made in this series, range is//was 0-41,000)

Last 4 digits from serial number are the numbers on all the bolt components and bolt.

Everything is marked with the 4 leafed, katakana (phonetic symbol) in a circle,  is on all parts including the stock

Wood Butt Stock End, Very rough wood stock that has the correct marks but it surprises me they were this rough in feel

Bolt action works better than some newer rifles I have had. It is still a bit stiff but works extremely well.

Last Ditch Rifle
As the war progressed, Japan quickly began to run short of raw materials. Indeed one of their primary motivations in starting the war was the need for ready supplies of raw materials to support domestic industry. Whats worse, war with America necessitated an increase in rifle production. Therefore, by 1942 many simplifications began to appear on Type 99 rifles. By 1943, so many simplifications had been introduced, that the rifle was re-designated the Substitute Type 99. In the collector world, the Substitute Type 99 is the Last Ditch Arisaka. So contrary to popular myth, the last ditch rifle was actually produced for the last three years of World War II (representing almost the entire duration of the War with the United States), and not just in the desperate days of 1945.

I got this as a partial trade and am offering it up for sale as I probably will never go shoot it and it is nice (all things considered) and would be appreciated more by a collector than me.
Problems I noticed
Bayonet Lug is loose and the attachment lug has been removed (I have it but it was taken off.
Bottom front of stock is missing
Thats all I noticed, but keep in mind I am not a collector and it may have other things missing that I am not aware of.

Most of these that I have seen for sale are missing the Mum (ground off) or have mismatched bolt. This has the Mum and bolt numbers Match the receiver. Ones that are matching go for $500 and up
Additional Hi-Res pictures available

$200 obo or Trade
Trades of Most Newer Firearms Considered, Auto Handguns Preferred but I will look at all offers.
Will meet  way, within reason
I am in the Longmont Area
Email for quickest response
REDACTED

Available at www.Nelsontactical.com

In 2001, DPMS expanded from its share of the .223/5.56mm market, and exploded onto the .308 rifle scene. The LR-308, the first and foremost of the .308 line, and for which the rifle series is named, is a rifle to be reckoned with. So much so that it was named the NRA Rifle of the year in 2005.
With a 24 stainless bull barrel, 1 in 10 twist and free floating handguard and a flat top receiver for easier mounting of optics, the LR-308 has gone toe to toe with bolt action rifles and delivered comparable accuracy, with higher magazine capacity and rate of fire. The conventional thought that "only a bolt action could be considered a precision rifle" has been in contention ever since.
This rifle features several factory installed modifications including replacing the slick side high rise upper receiver with an A3 upper receiver with forward assist, shell deflector and dust cover. Installing a JP adjustable trigger in place of the standard trigger, replacing the vented free float tube for the standard free float tube and giving the bull barrel a bead blasted finish.

title: For Sale/Trade:  NFA Class III Gun Trust, (additional Estate Planning Package, see inside)
postcontent:
If you live in Seminole or Orange County, feel free to contact me for a free face-to-face consultation. I also do Personal Injury as well. I prefer money but having known lots of people who have plenty of nice guns that they no longer shoot, and no longer wish to own, but wish to have NFA Trusts as well as other estate planning documents, I figured this would be a good idea. I will do private sales, and sales using an FFL dealer for trades. Trades don't necessarily have to be matching value but should be reasonably close, we can haggle if you want when it comes to trades, not cash. I will consider handguns (semi-automatics and revolvers) and rifles, and ammo in addition for said trades.

Whatever I get will sit in my collection for a number of years so as not be in the business of buying and selling, be used for my enjoyment, or later sold via an FFL dealer(I like to buy privately but I don't like to sell privately but for the rare exception something has sat in my possession for a few years), or used when I do my First Steps Pistol classes (I'm also an NRA Certified Pistol Instructor). I will consider trades for all or some of the value. If you have to the send me the firearm via an FFL transferor then you will have to cover shipping and also send me money via Paypal(list it as legal advice, this will document the transaction) to cover the cost of using an FFL transferor on my end.

If you would like an NFA Trust and you feel your firearm is worth more than the Trust I also have other estate planning documents with which to barter, as well as I will also draft documents for your family and friends (yes I have drafted Living Wills, and Healthcare Surrogacy forms for up to five people at a time in exchange for a S&W Model 10-8 4"). So feel free to call me or e-mail me(I prefer if you email because I am typically busy working during the day as a Lawyer).
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Private ownership of Class III firearms and items requires the local chief of police or sheriff's signature, fingerprints and photos, and when you are not present leaves your loved ones with constructive possession issues. 

Also the local chief of police or sheriff is not required to provide their signature and they may deny you your right own Class III items by simply "losing" the paperwork. With a proper Trust, that is avoided. Also my Trusts can be used in conjunction with a wide array of other estate planning documents.

An LLC requires annual fees and state filings or the LLC defaults leaving both you and your loved ones in possession of a restricted item. A Trust allows for people other than yourself(acting as Trustees) to use and enjoy the firearms as part of their duties in ensuring their proper protection, function, maintenance, and value.

A trust is an BATFE approved method of Class III item ownership that protects you, protects your friends and family from constructive possession issues and give you the control over when and where your items will be transferred after your death. Who will inherit them, who can inherit them, and if you would like, for the Trust to keep going on after your death so that your inheritors are still protected by the Trust. 

Generic and fill-in-the-blank asset or estate trusts from the internet or your buddy down the street who is not a lawyer, are not good enough. It may be enough for the application, but it might not be good enough should BATFE ever have a reason to look closer. Do it right the first time with a Trust that not only protects your Class III items, but can also protect your other assets. 

My Trusts are not slapped together Trusts, I can only finish them after I have spoken to you personally and consulted you about your needs, they are painstakingly assembled to work with Florida's laws and the NFA. The Trust can be used later in the future to acquire more Class III items as well, or as a larger part of your estate planning needs and desires.

For a total of $700 you can also get the Trust and:

Simple Will: for dispensation of personal effects and determination of burial. Not for the dispensation of your house. May be used to determine you takes your cars when you pass.

Memorandum of Trust: necessary for creating bank accounts in the name of the Trust.

Pour-Over Last Will & Testament: for having what assets you have not put in the Trust, added to the Trust. Also for having the proceeds from life insurance policies go to the Trust. Also I can prepare and mail letters to your life insurance carrier so that they put your Trust down as the beneficiary.

General Durable Power of Attorney: typically for when or if you become legally or medically incapacitated.

Specific Durable Limited Power of Attorney: can be used to take care of specific measures like selling or buying a car or house.

Appointment of Healthcare Surrogate

Alternative Appointment of Healtchare Surrogate

Codicil/Amendments: for when you may want to add things to your Will such as personal possessions.

Living Will: to have your desires be known in case you become afflicted so as to be in a vegetative state. I.E. be kept on life support, have the feeding tube remain in place, or prevent heroic medical measures.

Pet Trust: In the State of Florida it is no recognized how one can create a Trust for the care of their pets should they pass.


David Koberlein, Esq.
David Koberlein, P.A.
REDACTED
61 Seminola Blvd, Casselberry
Florida, 32707

title: For Sale:  1986 Marlin Model 60 Semi-Auto .22LR - Hard to find model
postcontent:
I am selling my '86 Marlin Model 60 in good condition. It has the 18 round capacity tube and the automatic "last-shot" bolt hold-open.

Model 60s were made with the higher capacity tube along and the auto hold-open from about 1985 to 1989.

Before 1985 the auto hold-open wasn't available and after 1989 the tube capacity was reduced to 14 rounds. A few years after that Marlin reduced the barrel length to match the shorter tube. This is a "real" Marlin... now that Remington owns the company you can do some Google research on the recent quality issues.

My name is Jason, call or text me at REDACTED
